item.title: DHCP reservation for a kvm virtual machine
item.description: In case you need a DHCP reservation for a kvm virtual machine, say for the debian11 one, you should first find the machine’s mac address: $ virsh dumpxml debian11 | grep 'mac address' <mac address='52:54:00:6a:c0:15'/> Then find the network name: virsh net-list Name State Autostart Persistent -------------------------------------------- default active yes yes and edit the XML configuration: $ virsh net-edit default <network> <name>default</name> <uuid>f2e7f420-1cf3-4535-8469-d3dfdaaf9ffc</uuid> <forward mode='nat'/> <bridge name='virbr0' stp='on' delay='0'/> <mac address='52:54:00:a9:7e:b5'/> <ip address='192.
